main event: On September 18, 1954, at Kimpo AB, Korea, several blinking lights in the sky were observed at an estimated altitude of 30,000 feet. The object maneuvered in a generally northeasterly direction and was tracked on radar for approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed to be about the size of a palm hand at arms length and had a color resembling the glare of strong sunlight on polished aluminum.
The lights were at an estimated altitude of 30,000 feet and maneuvered in a generally northeasterly direction.
The object was observed for approximately 11 to 13 minutes and appeared to be about the size of a pinhead with a bright light on it.
The object was moving in a westerly direction at a high altitude, and no streamers, tail, or specific structure could be seen, only a bright white light.
The object was too bright for a star at dawn, ruling out the possibility of it being a weather balloon. The radar station had no plots in the area during the time the object was sighted.
witnesses: Multiple military personnel including tower controllers and weather personnel
